alert.note: Alert for Henderson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 10 at 12:34PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Henderson County in Western North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 400 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1229 PM EDT, After a local 2 inch rainfall this morning, developing out of bank conditions along Mud and Bat Fork Creeks were occurring. Watch for flooding of low-lying areas along these creeks and their tributaries across greater Hendersonville. It is possible that East Caswell Street will flood. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hendersonville, Flat Rock, Laurel Park, Valley Hill, East Flat Rock and Crab Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
